docs.lead_paragraph: I have served my time with the fetus police. I have been told that sushi, salami, iced tea and chocolate mousse were bad for the traveling companion I hauled around inside my midsection, and I have been told it by perfect strangers. And I have itched to join the force myself. There is something about seeing a pregnant woman with a cigarette in her hand that always makes me want to sneak up behind her and say, in a teeny-tiny follow-the-yellow-brick-road kind of voice, "Air! Air! I can't breathe in here!"
